definition: Gross Domestic Product measures the monetary value of all final goods and services produced within a country's borders over a specified period of time.
Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services is rising
Interest rates are the rates at which interest is paid by borrowers (debtors) for the use of money that they borrow from lenders (creditors).
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures the average change in prices over time that consumers pay for a basket of goods and services.
The unemployment rate is the percentage of the total labor force that is unemployed but actively seeking employment and willing to work.
